comment: Great professor! Sometimes a little hard to understand, but your grade relies strictly on homework and tests.

I'm talking from an online student because of Covid. He gives 3 20 question multiple-choice tests and Webassign Homework. He doesn't email you back and you cant see the Test to review or see what you missed. He does however give you the whole day to take it and all tests and homework are due on Fridays. Do badly om one test? you're screwed!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Anyone complaining about this professor shouldn't be in school. Dr. Kulasiri demonstrates and thoroughly derives calculations in an effort to persuade students what school is about: Learning and NOT memorization. Of course, you get the babies in here who want to be spoonfed an A. If that happened, what would an A be worth if everyone had one?

Great professor , will give you power points for each unit with videos explaining the concept. Also will have homework on Webassign. Follow the power points and videos and you should do well. He doesn't pull any tricks on his exams/quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: WHY DOES HE MAKE THE SIMPLE THINGS SO COMPLICATED? Online test would be nice, he is so difficult to understand and this class is a HUGE time waster for those trying to focus on MAJOR classes.

He is average when it comes to lecturing. He has an accent. My biggest problem is the homework he gives. He gives the worst homework ever. To be clear, when I say his homework is bad, its not because its hard. Its bad because it cant be done without looking up outside information, and is entirely unhelpful when it comes to the test.

Class was extremely easy and straightforward.  All the information/formulas you need are in powerpoints.  Textbook is not needed at all, do not buy it.  All homework is online on WebAssign which works fine.  Tests are pretty short and very straightforward.  Do Hw and practice tests and you'll pass easily.

webassign had the hardest pobles, if you could do webassign, the tests were a BREEZE. The tests were easier than problems from the notes. easy A for just showing up and copying notes. wish I could get him for physics 2

Great professor. Very laid back and cares about students. If you need help, just ask! He will not make you feel bad for not understanding. Pay close attention to the problems he does in class... those will  be on the tests. Do your homework and review his in class problems and you'll be fine! Would definitely take him again.

He is a really nice teacher. Will help you anytime you ask. I probably asked him literally over 100 question and he always answered with a smile and came back to check up on me. He is an amazing teacher and is very interested in phys. Gives you every opportunity to do great in his class. Just do the work, listen closely, and take lots of notes.

An eh teacher. Not good, but eh. His grading style is unbalanced.  Your grade hinges on 4 tests which vary in difficulty. I failed 1 but received 2 As and a B, yet earned a C. The hardest part to deal with was his accent/laid back style. He is a mellow teacher, however his in-class problems are a fraction of the difficulty of his tests. Use Caution

SOME TO CLASS TAKE NOTES...MAKE SURE YOU PRACTICE THE PROBLEMS THAT ARE DISCUSSED IN CLASS! TEST ARE NOT EASY BUT ONCE YOU PRACTICE YOULL KNOW HOW TO SOLVE THEM. HE IS CRITICAL ON THE GRADING WITH THE LAB BUT IN ALL YOU WILL PASS
Really nice and helpful professor. He gives you all you need to ace the tests, so take plenty of notes. One of my favorite so far at SPSU!
Great professor. Hard to get over the language barrier but once you do that class is VERY easy and VERY straight forward.
One of the most difficult teachers I have had yet. Very confusing, was able to teach myself enough to scoot by. WOULD TAKE SOMEONE ELSE unless you are a wiz at Physics.

Don't take him if you want to learn. His examples have little to do with the test. He does let you use a formula sheet, not that it helps because the tests are 20 questions multiple choice and even if your math is right and you just missed a sign you get no partial credit.this class is less about teaching physics and more of a weed out class.

Dr. Kulasiri is one of the best professors I've had so far. The class was also one of the largest I've encountered, but it was still fun and easy. He lets you use a formula sheet on the exam and usually only requires certain sections of labs to be completed. He is also soft-spoken and has a bit of an accent, but it's usually not an issue.

I like him. Very prepared and thourough. Good sense of humor and despite the accent, I understood him easily. He did not take attendance. His test were moderately difficult. Study and do ALL the homework problems(even though he doesn't grade HW) and you'll do fine.

He's a nice enough guy and knows his stuff but doesn't really prepare you for his tests.  He does curve though and I imagine if you know Physics already you'd breeze through it. But after taking his final I felt like I didn't learn anything all semester.  Actually the final was ridiculously hard, surprising given the 'sample' final he provided us

very smart at what he teaches, however hes not a very good "teacher" everything done in this class is almost solo. he doesnt care about attendance which can mean he doesnt care about your progress in this class.  if your a genius in physics, take him because it would be easy to sweep by, but if you dont know the subject take PATTERSON.

Not a fan. His accent is a little hard to understand but you will get used to it. Doesn't give good reviews for his tests and the tests are three 25pt questions with five 5pt questions so don't miss anything. Good news is he usually curves. Our class had a 20pt, 10pt, 15pt and 4pt curve on our tests just to bring the averages up to passing.

Good professor with an understanding of the material he teaches.  His accent is sometimes a little hard to comprehend.  Very few grades, 2 tests and a final.  Go over the notes and look through the book before the test and you should be fine.

This guy is super friendly, easy, and comprehensive. Physics 2 was a little harder but it could have been a lot worse. Tells you exactly what you need to know on the test the day before. Never did homework and got a B without trying.

Above average teacher. He covers the material thoroughly and gives you a good idea what to expect on the tests. His accent isn't a problem unless you sit in the back because he speaks softly. He is very friendly and enjoys answering questions and having class participation. Take good notes and you only need the book for homework.
Would love to know more about this professor, if anybody has taken him before please write about him, Thanks
